text:
Apple will spend $ 2.5 billion to deal with the housing crisis in California
04 Nov 2019, 15:27 by Ilya Sidorov
Apple has announced that it will allocate $ 2.5 billion to reduce the housing deficit in California. The company wants to solve the problem of a sharp increase in real estate prices in the state.
Before the world knew about Silicon Valley, and long before we transferred technology into our pockets, Apple called this region a home, and we feel a great civic responsibility to remain a place where people can live, have a family and contribute contribute to society Tim Cook, Apple CEO
Apple will partner with the California government and community organizations. The money will go to the following initiatives:
‚ñ™Ô∏è $ 1 billion in housing investment fund. Allocated to the design and construction of affordable houses
‚ñ™Ô∏è $ 1 billion in a mortgage fund to help low-income residents who want to buy their own housing. Needed to pay an advance payment on a mortgage
‚ñ™Ô∏è $ 300 million to buy land for construction in San Jose
‚ñ™Ô∏è $ 200 million to Housing Trust Silicon Valley and Destination: Home charities to help the homeless and the poor.
The company expects to spend all the money within two years. The exact timing depends on the number of developers.
The funds that Apple will return will go to support new housing projects over the next five years. [Apple]
